title: (x) Art Deco/30s style poster fonts - handdrawn, Gill Sans {gang, Eduardo}
content:
The fonts I'm after are quite commonly seen, so I'm sure someone will know what they are ?! I've got a couple of fairly close examples, but I'd like to get the real thing if I could.   
   
The first two I'm after are the ones found on vintage travel posters like this one :   
   
 [http://imagecache2.allposters.com/images/PIN/VNT16.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/imagecache2.allposters.com/images/PIN/VNT16.jpg)   
   
The orange font - is that the font I've seen that's called simply 'Art Deco', or does anything know of anything very similar (particularly if free !). Also, anyone know what the white \*'Monte Carlo Superieur'\* font is ?   
   
The third, 1930s font I'd like is the one seen, again on posters, but in particular British travel ones including British Rail. It's on these two posters :   
   
 [http://imagecache2.allposters.com/images/AWI/AW1160.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/imagecache2.allposters.com/images/AWI/AW1160.jpg)   
   
 [http://imagecache2.allposters.com/images/VIS/v202.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/imagecache2.allposters.com/images/VIS/v202.jpg)   
   
This font looks so simple - could it possibly just be arial or something ? Any advice on achieving this ?   
   
Cheers
author: anonymous

comments.content: Mark Simonson's [Mostra](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/ms-studio.com/FontSales/mostra.html) is quite close to the face used for the _'Monte Carlo Superieur'_ text in the first poster.

Try this site for art deco style fonts   
 [http://www.nicksfonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/www.nicksfonts.com/)
And don't forget [Neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/www.houseindustries.com/house.php?kit=NEUTRAFACE-FO) if you need lowercase too.
And [Iron Man](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/ironman-sg/) is a very fat one, also with lowercase.
Neutra Display looks pretty close to the Monte Carlo type.

Yeah, though the lowercase at the bottom is very [Nobel](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-nobel/).   
And [Geometric 415](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-415/), Bitstream's version of [Metro](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/metro-2/), is also   
very much in the same vein.   
   
Re: ITC Johnston: check P22's [Underground](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415133447/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/underground/) too.
The third one looks like Gill Sans.
